item.title: Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation MovementPadres & JÃ³venes Unidos was live.The company, Palantir Technologies, is ICEâ€™s...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation MovementPadres & JÃ³venes Unidos was live.

The company, Palantir Technologies, is ICEâ€™s technology backbone, providing the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants. Palantirâ€™s tool...s have been used to conduct mass workplace raids, including the biggest raid in US history in which 680 people were detained in Mississippi. Palantir moved its headquarters to Colorado this month. Let's show them that they are not welcome in our city and state! We will not let Palantir profile our people and separate our families.

item.title: ğŸš¨ TODAY: Join Coloradans as we refuse to partner with...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

ğŸš¨ TODAY:

Join Coloradans as we refuse to partner with Palantir by giving them a hearty unwelcome!

The company, Palantir Technologies, is ICEâ€™s technology backbone, providing the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants. Palantirâ€™s tools have been used to conduct mass workplace raids, including the biggest raid in US history in which 680 people were detained in Mississippi. Palantir moved its headquarters to Colorado this month. Let's show them that th...ey are not welcome in our city and state! We will not let Palantir profile our people and separate our families.

Meet outside 1555 Blake Street at 4pm for a socially distant "Unwelcome Party"! MASKS REQUIRED! And Sign this petition to pledge your resistance to Palantir and ICE: https://actionnetwork.org/â€¦/palantir-out-of-colorado-palanâ€¦/

item.title: DACA WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY YOUNG LGBTQ+ IMMIGRANTS. NOW WE MUST...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

DACA WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY YOUNG LGBTQ+ IMMIGRANTS. NOW WE MUST FIGHT FOR THEM, TOO

"We know this fight is far from over. In many ways, itâ€™s just beginning. DACA was made possible thanks to the organizing efforts of young immigrants, many of them queer, who pushed President Obama to announce it in the summer of 2012...For many of us, including myself, DACA was never the end goal. We knew in 2012 that DACA was supposed to be a stepping stone towards liberation and protection for all our families, especially those who are often deemed not deserving of rights. Our end goal is the safety and liberation of all people, but especially of trans and queer undocumented people."

- Jorge Gutierrez, Familia; Trans Queer Liberation

The Supreme Court upheld the Obama-era policy, but there is still work to be done to protect the most vulnerable among us

mtv.com

DACA Was Made Possible By Young LGBTQ+ Immigrants. Now We Must Fight For Them, Too

The Supreme Court upheld the Obama-era policy, but there is still work to be done to protect the most vulnerable among usThe Supreme Court upheld the Obama-era policy, but there is still work to be done to protect the most vulnerable among us

item.title: Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement+9Isaias Vazquez is with Bere Ruiz Almanza and 7 others.ğŸŒˆâœŠğŸ½ Yesterdayâ€™s action...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement+9Isaias Vazquez is with Bere Ruiz Almanza and 7 others.

ğŸŒˆâœŠğŸ½ Yesterdayâ€™s action felt nostalgic for some of us. We got DACA in 2012 by escalating from sharing our stories to protesting, hunger strikes, blocking highway...s, occupying campaign offices.

This is how we wanted to celebrate, and process. This was a statement of solidarity, intersectionality, a reminder that our movement has work to do.

Everything you saw was 100% envisioned and lead by Unafraid Trans, Queer Undocumented, & DACAmented folx. Organized in just 5 days.

Thankful for friends and allies, I wish I could hug you all. This is community!

Please make a donation to help us with some of our expenses, food and materials.

https://secure.actblue.com/donate/pjuaf

Padres & JÃ³venes Unidos Action Fund
Text UNDOCU303 to 474747 to keep up with us.

Firme la peticiÃ³n para exigir que UnivisiÃ³n y Telemundo deja de alimentar la anti-Ne...gritud: bit.ly/lasvidasnegrasimportan

"Entiendo que va haber mucho dolor en este momento para nuestra comunidad pero tambiÃ©n tenemos una responsabilidad de hacer conecciÃ³n de todo lo que estÃ¡ pasando. Por que la comunidad Negra estÃ¡ marchando y protestando en estos momentos? Porque la policÃ­a sigue matando a la gente Negra. Porque la patrulla fronteriza estÃ¡ matando a nuestra gente en la frontera entonces mi llamado ahorita en nuestra comunidad es pensar mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de nosotros, hacer todas las conecciones, tomar las calles, organizarnos para que toda esta violencia puede terminar. Y ustedes como UnivisiÃ³n tienen responsabilidad de contar toda la historia de todo lo que esta pasando asÃ­ como hablamos de las deportaciones ustedes tambiÃ©n tienen que hablar por que la gente sigue muriendo en manos de la policÃ­a, particularmente la gente Negra. Ese es mi llamado. En este momento hacer negocio con esta administraciÃ³n es una traiciÃ³n a la comunidad Negra y a las familias que siguen muriendo."

******
Sign the petition to demand UnivisiÃ³n and Telemundo stop their antiBlack coverage: bit.ly/lasvidasnegrasimportan

"I understand that there is going to be a lot of pain right now for our community but we also have a responsibility to make connections between everything that is happening. Why is the Black community marching and protesting right now? Because the police are still killing Black people. Because border patrol is killing our people. So my call to action right now in our community is to think beyond us, make these connections, take to the streets, and organize so that all this violence can end. And you as Univision have a responsibility to tell the whole story of everything that is happening, just like how we talk about deportations, you also have to talk about why people keep dying at the hands of the police, particularly Black people. That is my call to action. Right now doing business with this administration is a betrayal of the Black community and the families that continue to die. "

item.title: On the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

On the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, also known as DACA, weâ€™re releasing this open letter to the immigrant rights movement with a clear demand: not a single person or organization should use the rescission of DACA to seek compromises that further fund any immigration enforcement in exchange for relief for some of us. Do not sell out immigrant communities.

#Undocu303 #DACA
#AbolishPolice #AbolishICE
#ResignTrump #DontLookAway

Padres & JÃ³venes Unidos Action FundOn the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, also known as DACA, weâ€™re releasing this open letter toâ€¦

medium.com

An Open Letter from Undocumented, DACAmented and formerly Undocumented Leaders to the Immigrantâ€¦

item.author: Colorado - Familia

item.title: Friends, As we stand in solidarity in the fight for Black lives,...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

Friends, As we stand in solidarity in the fight for Black lives, thousands of people in the immigrant community also await a Supreme Court decision on DACA with fear and anxiety. This decision can come at any time now.

Today, we ask everyone to join us in a day of action on the day of the SCOTUS decision. No matter what they decide, we will;

Call for Trump to resign,...
Join the fight for Black lives in a demand for local governments to #DefundThePolice departments across the country and reinvest in quality housing and education, financial and economic support, climate justice, healthcare for all, and mental health services and,
Demand the federal government to defund ICE and CBP as a first step to #AbolishICE.

This us an effort and a critical intervention from former Dream movement leaders and some organizations to inspire the DACA community and undocumented communities to take action once the Supreme Court comes down with a decision. We truly believe this opportunity must crack open more commitment and action to show solidarity and support for the Black Lives Matter movement. We must go beyond our own community in this moment and moving forward and demand to #DefundthePolice, #AbolishICE and call for #ResingTrump. Join this call to action and letâ€™s show up and show out.

Please sign up to participate here. We are hosting a call tomorrow to talk get us all going! We will be sending the call info tomorrow morning for those who sign up. DM for more info.

https://docs.google.com/â€¦/1FAIpQLSe0PjgClnSzBkfWqkâ€¦/viewform

See More

item.title: If your heart is breaking right now, donate to the CO Freedom...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

If your heart is breaking right now, donate to the CO Freedom Fund: they post bail regularly & is also posting to support those arrested in current actions:

https://fundly.com/coloradofreedom

Founded in 2018, Colorado Freedom Fund (CFF) is a revolving fund that pays ransom (posts money bond, pays cash bail) for people unable to afford the cost...

item.title: Las comunidades latinx deben levantarse ahora, correctas y...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

Las comunidades latinx deben levantarse ahora, correctas y poderosamente. El tiempo ahora exige modelar la pro-negritud y una sensaciÃ³n encarnada de que nuestrxs destinos estÃ¡n vinculados. Nuestra tarea es estar hombro con hombro y ponerlo en prÃ¡ctica. Este es el momento adecuado para desembolsar a la policÃ­a en cada una de nuestras ciudades y exigir que esos recursos sirvan y protejan a nuestras comunidades.

Lee sobre las formas de apoyar a nuestra gente en Minneapolis y porque debemos organizar para desfinanciar a la policÃ­a en cada ciudad.

mijente.net/â€¦/hacia-companerismo-y-conciencia-pro-blackneâ€¦/â€¦
